answers.answer:
Refugees from Ukraine under temporary protection in Romania are eligible for various social benefits, including support for mothers with newborns, monthly childcare support allowances for single parents, accommodation and allowances for minors, social services for persons with disabilities, state allowances for children, and unemployment benefits.

To find detailed information on eligibility criteria, required documents, application processes, and assistance amounts for each benefit, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read under the specific sections for each type of support.

To find detailed information on eligibility criteria, required documents, application processes, and assistance amounts for each benefit, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read under the specific sections for each type of support. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees

answers.answer:
Yes, there is financial support available for mothers with newborns from Ukraine in Romania, specifically a social voucher worth 2,000 RON for mothers who gave birth after April 12, 2024. Additionally, single parents or guardians may be eligible for a monthly childcare support allowance.

To find detailed information, please visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and look under the sections "Support for mothers with newborns" and "Monthly Childcare Support Allowance for Single Parents or Guardians."

For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees

answers.answer:
Yes, single parents or guardians from Ukraine under temporary protection in Romania are eligible for a monthly childcare allowance if they are caring for a child up to 2 years old, or up to 3 years old if the child has a disability.

To find detailed information, please visit the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees` and look under the section titled "Monthly Childcare Support Allowance for Single Parents or Guardians".

answers.answer:
Ukrainian minors under temporary protection in Romania are eligible for free accommodation in school dormitories, a daily food allowance, and additional financial support for school supplies, bedding, clothing, and footwear.

To find detailed information, please visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and look for the section titled "Accommodation and Allowances for Ukrainian Minors".

To find detailed information, go to the website dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read under the section "Protection of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities".

answers.answer:
Yes, there is a state allowance available for Ukrainian children residing in Romania who are under temporary protection and meet the specified eligibility criteria. The monthly allowance ranges from 292 RON to 719 RON, depending on the child's age and whether they have a disability.

To find detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and refer to the section titled "State Allowance for Children".

Yes, refugees from Ukraine under temporary protection in Romania may be eligible for unemployment benefits under Government Emergency Ordinance No. 15/2022.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read under the section titled "Unemployment Benefits for Refugees Under Temporary Protection."

answers.answer:
Applications for social benefits for Ukrainian refugees in Romania are submitted to various local authorities depending on the specific type of benefit. These typically include the Social Assistance Directorate, county/municipality agencies for payments and social inspection, the General Directorate of Social Assistance and Child Protection (DGASPC), administrative-territorial units, or local Employment Agencies (ANOFM).

To find detailed information on where to apply for a specific social benefit, go to the website dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read under the section for the particular benefit you are interested in, such as "Support for mothers with newborns" or "Unemployment Benefits for Refugees Under Temporary Protection."

The documents typically required when applying for social benefits for Ukrainian refugees in Romania vary by the specific type of benefit, but generally include a temporary protection permit, an application form, identity documents, and relevant certificates such as birth or marriage certificates.

To find detailed information on the required documents for each specific social benefit, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and refer to the sections corresponding to each type of support, such as "Support for mothers with newborns", "Monthly Childcare Support Allowance", "State Allowance for Children", or "Unemployment Benefits".

answers.answer:
Yes, under the State Allowance for Children program in Romania, monthly allowance amounts vary based on the child's age and whether they have a disability. Children under 2, or under 3 with a disability, or aged 3 to 18 with disabilities receive a higher amount than children aged 2 to 18 without disabilities or youth over 18 enrolled in pre-university education.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read under the section "State Allowance for Children".

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read under the section "State Allowance for Children". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees

answers.answer:
The maximum duration for receiving unemployment benefits for refugees in Romania is 12 months for individuals with longer work history and higher earnings.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read under the section "Unemployment Benefits for Refugees Under Temporary Protection".

Yes, recipients of unemployment benefits in Romania are insured under the national health insurance system on the same terms as employed workers during the period they receive benefits.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees` and read under the section titled "Unemployment Benefits for Refugees Under Temporary Protection", specifically the subsection "Other Benefits".

For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees

answers.answer:
Individuals receiving the State Allowance for Children must submit a quarterly declaration confirming their residence. Those receiving unemployment benefits are required to attend monthly professional counseling meetings and report any changes in their status within three days.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read under the sections "State Allowance for Children" and "Unemployment Benefits for Refugees Under Temporary Protection."
